summary: Government-grade blockchain land registry system on Internet Computer Protocol with secure property transfers, identity verification, and multi-canister architecture
architectural_notes: ICP canister-based architecture with chain-key cryptography and threshold signatures
Four core canisters: LandRegistry, Identity, Payment, DocumentVerification
Land records include parcel_id, geo_coordinates, ownership_history with immutable blockchain timestamps
Zero-trust security with RBAC, multi-signature governance, and certified query responses
Regional canister sharding for horizontal scalability across subnets
Next.js frontend hosted on ICP Asset Canister with reverse gas model
Enterprise design system inspired by Google Cloud, Apple HIG, and AWS console aesthetics
External system verification using ICP chain-key signatures for GIS/banking/tax integration
Automated fraud detection triggers and dispute freeze mechanism
Multi-signature governance requiring Ministry of Lands, Judiciary, and ICT Authority approval

existing_features.title: Update all React Query hooks in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts to use automatic refetch intervals with staleTime configuration for continuous data synchronization
Add optimistic updates to mutation hooks in useQueries.ts so that property registration and transfer operations immediately reflect in the UI before backend confirmation
Implement automatic query invalidation in useQueries.ts after successful mutations to ensure related data refreshes across DashboardPage, PropertyDetailsPage, and SearchPage
Add loading states and real-time activity indicators to DashboardPage, PropertyDetailsPage, SearchPage, RegisterPage, and TransferPage to show when data is being synchronized

Update frontend/src/index.css and frontend/tailwind.config.js to implement a refined color palette with subtle gradients and elevated depth matching modern design systems, using softer neutrals, elevated shadows (with multiple layers), and sophisticated color tokens that avoid bright primary colors in favor of understated elegance

Refine all page components (HomePage.tsx, DashboardPage.tsx, SearchPage.tsx, PropertyDetailsPage.tsx, RegisterPage.tsx, TransferPage.tsx) with polished spacing using consistent padding scale (4, 8, 12, 16, 24, 32, 48, 64px), refined typography hierarchy with proper font weights and line heights, and generous whitespace between sections

Add smooth micro-interactions and polished animations to all interactive elements including buttons, cards, form inputs, and navigation items with subtle scale transforms on hover (scale-[1.02]), smooth color transitions (transition-all duration-200), and tactile feedback using transform and shadow changes

Enhance Header.tsx and Footer.tsx with refined layouts including proper alignment, balanced spacing, subtle backdrop blur effects for the header, and refined mobile responsiveness with smooth menu transitions

Refine form components in RegisterPage.tsx and TransferPage.tsx with polished input styling including refined borders, proper focus rings with brand colors, floating labels or clear placeholder text, inline validation feedback with smooth transitions, and cohesive button styling matching the overall design system

Add skeleton loading states to all data-fetching components (DashboardPage.tsx, SearchPage.tsx, PropertyDetailsPage.tsx) using shimmer animations and content placeholders that match the final content structure, ensuring smooth transitions from loading to loaded states

Implement smooth page transitions and scroll behaviors across all routes in App.tsx using CSS transitions or animation libraries, with fade-in effects for new page content and smooth scrolling for in-page navigation

Refine card components across all pages with elevated shadows, subtle border radius (rounded-lg or rounded-xl), proper internal padding, and hover states that include scale and shadow transitions to create depth and interactivity

Enhance responsive design across all pages to ensure layouts adapt gracefully to different screen sizes with appropriate breakpoints (sm, md, lg, xl, 2xl), mobile-first design patterns, and touch-friendly interface elements with adequate tap target sizes (minimum 44x44px)
